JobFullDesc: Microsoft’s Operations Finance Revenue Recognition team is looking for a highly motivated, collaborative accounting professional to join our Operations Finance Revenue Recognition team Our team is responsible for the accuracy for billions of dollars of revenue across the world for both US GAAP and local statutory reporting. If you enjoy a dynamic environment combined with complex challenges and you have a deep desire to learn, consider joining our team of revenue recognition experts.ResponsibilitiesStatutory / EMEA Local GAAP Revenue:Lead for EMEA Local GAAP Revenue Recognition.Ownership of EMEA Local GAAP Revenue adjustment process to correctly reflect revenue under local GAAP for EMEA entities not aligned to US GAAP / IFRS 15, Germany, Austria and France.Subject matter expert providing technical advice to the EMEA Statutory Centre of Excellence to ensure that revenue is accurately reported.Local GAAP AFS and Audit process support from a Revenue Recognition perspective.Collaborate with Global Revenues Recognition team to identify common issues and address in a consistent manner.Deliver quarterly review (CR4.1) on Consolidated EMEA Revenue for management review and sign off.Lead training and development of Local GAAP Revenue Recognition knowledge across the EMEA team.Provide Revenue Recognition training for the Statutory Centre of Excellence and provide updates as required on Local GAAP.US GAAP Contract Reviews and Technical Consultations:Review contractual arrangements in accordance with US GAAP to identify language that may require non-standard accounting treatment.Be a subject matter expert providing technical advice on revenue recognition influencing deal structures for compliant reporting. Work with Corporate Accounting, Business desk and Operations teams to understand and resolve issues identified in the contractual arrangement reviews.Key contributor to the evaluation of revenue recognition issues including documenting accounting positions.Roll-out and implementation of new corporate revenue policies. Collaborate with counterparts in the US and Singapore to identify global issues and establish best practices and consistency.QualificationsMinimum qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Data Science or related field AND financial analysis, accounting, controllership or Finance work experienceOR equivalent experience.Preferred qualifications:Qualified ACA / ACCA / CIMA.Minimum 8-10 years of related work experience in a large industry or public accounting firm. People Management or Team leadership experience.Strong technical US GAAP and IFRS 15 knowledge, with emphasis on ASC 606 Revenue from contracts with customers and IFRS 15.Strong planning and organizational skills with ability to work under tight deadlines.Excellent communication skills.Demonstrated Growth Mindset. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
